{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3618405,"name":"Dalton","username":"daltzsmith","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/daltzsmith/{size}/206287_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-09T19:32:02.332Z","cooked":"

Another year, another feedback survey. This year, we rolled out a ton of new features in response to the awesome feedback you guys gave last year. A non-exhaustive list of those features and changes below

  • Came out with seven (Kraken X44, WCP ThroughBore, CANdi, CANrange, Talon FXS, Minion, PDP 2.0) new products addressing a wide range of use cases.
  • Various performance and portability improvements to the Swerve Generator and Swerve API
  • Introduced Java units to the API to minimize unit related conversion errors in user code
  • Introduced Hoot Replay - A super easy way to get signals replayed from a hoot log
  • Focused on our Tuner and diagnostics support, introducing a high-performance flexible plotter
  • Lots of miscellaneous improvements for our current limiting, API shape, firmware behavior and more.

We love feedback of our devices, and use that to drive future product and software development. We are very interested in hearing how folks used our products, our API, and more and what we can improve upon for 2026. We would appreciate it if teams could fill out the below survey and let us know your thoughts!

Survey: 2025 Phoenix Feedback

Zhou","username":"NathanZhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-09T19:50:02.589Z","cooked":"

Signal log caused me some issue on rio 1.

Specifically when it write too much data to rio 1 built in flash (when I don‚Äôt have a flash drive inserted), it will result not able to push any code to rio1 unless SSH into rio and remove all the new log. To makes things worse, swerve project generated by Phoenix tuner had logging enabled by default.

Feature requests

Add CANDle support to Phoenix 6.

Add an option to generate Swerve as a Advantage Kit style subsystem.

Bmongar:

Add CANDle support to Phoenix 6

Phoenix 6 25.4.0 (Introducing CANdle Phoenix 6 support) Technical Discussion
Phoenix 6 25.4.0 Hey folks! Hope everyone has had an amazing 2025 season and congratulations to the season winners 1323, 2910, 4272, 5026! We are announcing the release of version 25.4.0 of our Phoenix 6 library. With this release comes a long time ask of CANdle Phoenix 6 support. [image] Currently, this release contains CANdle feature-parity with Phoenix 6, and introductory support for LED control in Phoenix Tuner X (Tuner v2025.4.1.0). We have several CANdle and CANdle related Tuner features‚Ä¶
","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2025-05-12T11:52:53.443Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":413,"readers_count":412,"score":192.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":501488,"topic_slug":"ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback","display_username":"Bryce Roethel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/phoenix-6-25-4-0-introducing-candle-phoenix-6-support/500978","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Phoenix 6 25.4.0 (Introducing CANdle Phoenix 6 support)","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60072,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback/501488/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3621839,"name":"Kyle Reeve","username":"kreeve","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kreeve/{size}/187015_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-12T15:18:47.553Z","cooked":"

Overall since Phoenix 6 came out all the CTRE hardware and software has worked very well.

One feature idea I brought up in my survey is having a way to modify current limits without a config change. Either per-request or per-slot. I think a lot of teams are finding a need to run with more or less aggressive current limits in different phases of a match.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2025-05-12T15:20:07.337Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":379,"readers_count":378,"score":105.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":501488,"topic_slug":"ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback","display_username":"Kyle Reeve","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":10385,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback/501488/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3621892,"name":"Brad","username":"Bmongar","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bmongar/{size}/228654_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-12T15:59:56.307Z","cooked":"

One more while I am at it. have an ability to configure control request to cancel on disable. This is a safety feature to prevent problems in testing where the bot is disabled then looked at then reenabled and having an elevator or arm snap back to position.

We do enable a disable command for our subsystems for this to prevent the problem but it would be safer and nicer to have that configured.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2025-05-12T15:59:56.307Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":363,"readers_count":362,"score":167.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":501488,"topic_slug":"ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback","display_username":"Brad","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38557,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector "},"post_url":"/t/ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback/501488/6","custom_user_title":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3622217,"name":"Tom Line","username":"Tom_Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-12T19:14:58.157Z","cooked":"

Agreed. We set all our motors to voltage mode and command 0 volts. That way they don‚Äôt move when the robot goes back into auto until they are commanded to go back into motion control.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2025-05-12T19:14:58.157Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":333,"readers_count":332,"score":101.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":501488,"topic_slug":"ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback","display_username":"Tom Line","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":38557,"username":"Bmongar","name":"Brad","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bmongar/{size}/228654_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7841,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 1498"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback/501488/7","custom_user_title":"Team 1498","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3622221,"name":"Tim Winters","username":"ArchdukeTim","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/archduketim/{size}/256125_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-12T19:19:32.810Z","cooked":"

Change the default name of a canivore log to be the user-set bus name, and not the serial number of the canivore device. It was easy enough for us to figure out which log was the canivore log because we only had one, but if we wanted to have a second canivore, it would be tough for someone new to figure out which log file went to which canivore.

edit: just saw the survey link. I‚Äôll put this feedback there too

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2025-05-12T19:19:56.978Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":332,"readers_count":331,"score":81.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":501488,"topic_slug":"ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback","display_username":"Tim Winters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19820,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"78 AIR Strike Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback/501488/8","custom_user_title":"78 AIR Strike Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3623471,"name":"Ryan Shavell","username":"Ryan_S","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_s/{size}/250016_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-13T19:49:48.324Z","cooked":"

Very little to say other than 2025 Phoenix was fantastic! Slipping in support for the CANdle was a nice post-champs treat too.

The only thing I can think to add is it would be nice to have a bit more information on how TorqueCurrentFOC control and tuning works. Maybe just an added section on how to tune it and how it‚Äôs different from typical voltage/duty cycle based tuning, and perhaps some examples of when it makes more sense to use it over voltage control.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2025-05-13T19:49:48.324Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":303,"readers_count":302,"score":135.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":501488,"topic_slug":"ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback","display_username":"Ryan Shavell","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24486,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"180 Software Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback/501488/9","custom_user_title":"180 Software Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3623542,"name":"Dan Katzuv","username":"dan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/eada6e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-13T20:12:03.864Z","cooked":"

It‚Äôd be nice to be able to see the names of the devices in the hoot log, and not just the CAN IDs.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2025-05-13T20:12:03.864Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":290,"readers_count":289,"score":58.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":501488,"topic_slug":"ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback","display_username":"Dan Katzuv","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32004,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5987 Software Mentor üáÆüá±"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback/501488/10","custom_user_title":"5987 Software Mentor üáÆüá±","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3634553,"name":"Dan Nichols","username":"jnicho15","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jnicho15/{size}/7893_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-23T20:14:54.256Z","cooked":"

I was going to submit feedback about the Swerve API specifically, but I realized I don‚Äôt fully understand how this works, so I‚Äôll ask here:

I noticed SwerveModuleConstants.SteerFeedbackType has a new option TalonFXS_PulseWidth, and this is only FXS-specific option.

Within the FXS configuration, I noticed the choices of ExternalFeedbackSensorSourceValue are similar to the FX FeedbackSensorSourceValue enumeration, with RotorSensor replaced with Commutation and the addition of PulseWidth and Quadrature.

There doesn‚Äôt (yet) appear to be any sensing modes which fuse/sync the commutation sensor against a Gadgeteer-port sensor (i.e. a Mag Encoder). I haven‚Äôt tried it yet on a bot, but I can‚Äôt imagine the velocity measurement fidelity would be that great driving swerve azimuth PID directly with a 1:1 pulse width sensor?

I know the hall sensor measurement on an FXS is rather lower fidelity than the internal magnetic rotor encoder on an FX, but I‚Äôd still imagine it‚Äôs better than trying to calculate velocity from an external pulse width that‚Äôs probably only updating at 250Hz. Certainly a hardwired 250Hz sensor is better than a non-Pro, non-FD CANcoder at 100Hz, but it seems like there is a gap where a ‚ÄúFusedPulseWidth‚Äù mode would give a respectable middle ground?

In a similar vein, another useful feedback option might be the return of something like the TalonSRX_SelectedSensor remote sensor type. I suppose for teams that use the PowerPole adapter boards it isn‚Äôt as big of a deal because they can power CANcoders straight from a Kraken, but for us we could have saved a couple wires going up our elevator if we could have ‚Äòborrowed‚Äô the sensor port on an FXS/SRX to use as a fused sensor for a Kraken. Similarly for limit switches, I see there is a RemoteTalonFX limit source value, does that support FXS?

I‚Äôm not sure how much it was a packaging concern vs. a design choice, but there being no ‚Äòbasic‚Äô external sensor interface on the Kraken series (not even limit switches like the Falcon) is a bit frustrating. I‚Äôm certainly glad the FXS brings back the Gadgeteer port, so we don‚Äôt have to decide between home-running a limit switch to the RIO or adding an entire CANdi for one digital input if we have an FXS nearby.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2025-05-23T20:15:57.077Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":286,"readers_count":285,"score":57.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":501488,"topic_slug":"ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback","display_username":"Dan Nichols","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23941,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 548 Robostangs Electrical & Pneumatics Lead Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback/501488/11","custom_user_title":"FRC 548 Robostangs Electrical & Pneumatics Lead Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3739972,"name":"Jared Russell","username":"Jared_Russell","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jared_russell/{size}/399_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-15T18:55:16.469Z","cooked":"

  1. Hoot logs are enabled by default only when FMS is enabled, but this also has the potential to suck CPU away from other things in ways that are not trivially reproducible at home. We disabled this in matches for the CPU. We wish that we could have kept this on for better logging and debugging for our 250Hz loop.

  2. It would be great to figure out a better solution than synchronous configuration calls. Some of the configuration calls are done in control requests which makes those easy, but there are some others that we use in some situations. Because of this, we end up having to make non-blocking calls, or hack some asynchronous usage. If there was an out of the box asynchronous call for config setting that would be awesome. (Example implementation: using a Future for the result of the config setting, so user code can easily decide if/how to block on success without holding up the main loop)

  3. We spent way too long debugging the discontinuity point on the wrist because we weren‚Äôt sure if it took into account the magnet offset or not. After some experimentation, we later learned that it is applied after offset, but it would be helpful if the documentation made this clear.

  4. We ran into a lot of issues with the x44 reaching thermal shutdown in stall conditions, even when the stall torque was miniscule (sub 1V motor command). I believe this is what contributed to many of the weird wrist issues we had at Championships. I‚Äôm not sure if there is a good solution here beyond asking to reevaluate the thermal limits of the x44. We probably should have kept the x60 on our wrist because of this issue, and unless we hear otherwise we will probably stick with x60s on any mechanism that is designed to stall in normal operation (ex. arms that fight gravity, mechanisms that are sprung).

  5. We had a couple of servoed, non-continuous rotation mechanisms with non-linear transforms between the motor and the CANcoder (in one case they were on different links of a non-parallel 4-bar, in the other there was a spool so that the direction of the output would switch once we hit the end of the rope). This meant that remote/fused CANcoder couldn‚Äôt work in these cases. We‚Äôre not sure there‚Äôs much that could be done about this without allowing users to specify an arbitrary function mapping input to output, which doesn‚Äôt seem worth the squeeze. The main lesson to us is to yell at the mechanical team to give us linear mappings in the future.

  6. We had some success using ForceTorqueFOC this year for velocity loops, but not for position tracking. In talking with CTRE staff at the Championship, the hypothesis is that kD is basically mandatory for ForceTorqueFOC to provide good loop closure on position (especially without motion magic). It would be good to explain this somewhere in the documentation.

  7. Occasionally someone would leave PhoenixTuner open on a laptop when the robot was enabled. This absolutely wrecked loop timing.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2025-09-15T18:55:16.469Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":253,"readers_count":252,"score":150.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":501488,"topic_slug":"ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback","display_username":"Jared Russell","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/team-254-presents-2025-undertow-technical-binder-code-q-a/506115/62","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Team 254 Presents: 2025 UNDERTOW - Technical Binder, Code, Q&A","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1267,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Oh so close"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback/501488/12","custom_user_title":"Oh so close","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3739990,"name":"Benjamin Hall","username":"bhall-ctre","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bhall-ctre/{size}/198180_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-15T19:13:10.669Z","cooked":"

Thanks for the feedback! Just to comment on a few of these points that have already been addressed:

Jared_Russell:

Hoot logs are enabled by default only when FMS is enabled, but this also has the potential to suck CPU away from other things in ways that are not trivially reproducible at home.

In 2026, this behavior is changing to match the behavior in our 2027 alpha-2 release, with the additional caveat that auto-logging will only be enabled on the roboRIO 1 if a USB drive is present.

Jared_Russell:

We spent way too long debugging the discontinuity point on the wrist because we weren‚Äôt sure if it took into account the magnet offset or not. After some experimentation, we later learned that it is applied after offset, but it would be helpful if the documentation made this clear.

This has been addressed in our 25.4.0 post-season release (changelog), which included some API documentation updates.

Jared_Russell:

We had some success using ForceTorqueFOC this year for velocity loops, but not for position tracking. In talking with CTRE staff at the Championship, the hypothesis is that kD is basically mandatory for ForceTorqueFOC to provide good loop closure on position (especially without motion magic). It would be good to explain this somewhere in the documentation.

I have an explanation of why position kD is required for TorqueCurrentFOC here, which we can adapt into our software documentation for 2026.

I have an explanation of why position kD is required for TorqueCurrentFOC here, which we can adapt into our software documentation for 2026.

In general, there are a lot of detailed explanations and code samples for Phoenix 6 that are only in a Discord or ChiefDelphi message somewhere. These explanations are valuable and you shouldn‚Äôt stop writing them, but it would be nice if you could also put valuable information somewhere on the documentation after writing it. If you can‚Äôt really find a place to put an explanation, I think quickly appending it to an ever-growing ‚ÄúFAQ‚Äù development blog post would be better than only having it searchable on CD/Discord.

On TorqueCurrentFOC PID control specifically, there is a page at How to Manually Tune your PID Loops which explains closed-loop tuning for that control type. (I have also been informed to note ‚Äúthe page is still a WIP (there‚Äôs some physics math errors in one of the simulators) ‚Ä¶ That page will likely make it into our 2026 docs once I fix that math.‚Äù)

Less of a software kind of thing, but

  • I would love it if the mounting holes on the CANrange and the CANdi were #10-32 instead of #8
  • I would love it if the CANdi outputted 10-30v for sensors like the Banner Q12RN6FF50Q3

Software things:

  • I would love better documentation for the CANrange (like which way is X and Y according to the sensor, and maybe even a simulated cone for your parameters in Phoenix Tuner X)

Overall, we are very happy with the products and the quality of those products that CTRE continues to make; there have been many moments this year where we have said, ‚Äúslap another CANdi on it‚Äù or ‚Äúthrow a CANrange at it,‚Äù and we have never regretted any of those decisions this season.
